Posts.EditableText:
Hi Alex,
I just tested the game City of Blood. The first command is evaluated correctly, but then no other command returns any output. I tested it online and offline. Perhaps you can have a look at it
Posts.HTML:
Hi Alex,
I just tested the game City of Blood. The first command is evaluated correctly, but then no other command returns any output. I tested it online and offline. Perhaps you can have a look at it

Posts.EditableText: The author of the game has reported this problem too - I will take a look into it (unless anybody else wants to have a go at debugging )
Posts.HTML: The author of the game has reported this problem too - I will take a look into it (unless anybody else wants to have a go at debugging )

Posts.EditableText: Since I wrote it I can't seem to find the bug as of yet. Since no one else has suggested this and I really would like people to play my game until I can debug it, then you can play it as follows: 1 Download Quest 4.1.5 from this site and install it (it plays alongside Quest 5). 2 Download the City of Blood.cas file. 2 Right mouse click the City of Blood.cas file and go to Properties. 3 Click the Change button. 4 If Q4 Quest.exe is not on the list, click Browse and find it in the C:Program Files/Quest/ then double click on it and highlight it. 5 Click Apply and then OK. Now all .cas files are assigned to play on the Quest 4 player and not the Quest 5 player and my game should now work. Sorry to those I'm patronizing with these instructions but considering (at this moment) 275 online plays will get you nowhere compared to 59 offline downloads, it seems that a few might not be heeding my warning in the game description and probably giving up too quickly and not playing it offline.
Posts.HTML:
Since I wrote it I can't seem to find the bug as of yet. Since no one else has suggested this and I really would like people to play my game until I can debug it, then you can play it as follows:

1 Download Quest 4.1.5 from this site and install it (it plays alongside Quest 5).
2 Download the City of Blood.cas file.
2 Right mouse click the City of Blood.cas file and go to Properties.
3 Click the Change button.
4 If Q4 Quest.exe is not on the list, click Browse and find it in the C:Program Files/Quest/ then double click on it and highlight it.
5 Click Apply and then OK.

Now all .cas files are assigned to play on the Quest 4 player and not the Quest 5 player and my game should now work.

Sorry to those I'm patronizing with these instructions but considering (at this moment) 275 online plays will get you nowhere compared to 59 offline downloads, it seems that a few might not be heeding my warning in the game description and probably giving up too quickly and not playing it offline.

Posts.EditableText:
I've just this morning uploaded Quest 5.1.1 which fixes the bug, and I've just deployed it to "play online" too, so this should be fixed now.

The reason the bug occurred in Quest 5.1.0 and earlier was to do with the "dontprocess" command - it will stop Quest from running any more commands. From what I could see, you're using it in an "after each turn" script. It appears in the editor as "Don't process the player's command", but you don't need to use it in an "after each turn" script as it should only have any effect in a "before each turn" script anyway.
Posts.HTML:
I've just this morning uploaded Quest 5.1.1 which fixes the bug, and I've just deployed it to "play online" too, so this should be fixed now.

The reason the bug occurred in Quest 5.1.0 and earlier was to do with the "dontprocess" command - it will stop Quest from running any more commands. From what I could see, you're using it in an "after each turn" script. It appears in the editor as "Don't process the player's command", but you don't need to use it in an "after each turn" script as it should only have any effect in a "before each turn" script anyway.

Posts.EditableText: Thanks, Alex.  I was going to reprogram it in Quest 5 if you couldn't find what was wrong.  Luckily, I found a few grammatical errors that needed fixing when I looked at the ASL script.  It works fine now , thanks again.
Posts.HTML: Thanks, Alex.  I was going to reprogram it in Quest 5 if you couldn't find what was wrong.  Luckily, I found a few grammatical errors that needed fixing when I looked at the ASL script.  It works fine now , thanks again.

Posts.EditableText:
[b:17isco9k]For Sarah and dme and anyone else who's interested here is the walkthru to the game.[/b:17isco9k]

EXAMINE MERIDAM, TAKE DART, X DESK, TAKE JOURNAL, READ JOURNAL, GO TO KITCHEN, OPEN CUPBOARD, TAKE MEAT, GO TO HERBALISTS, GIVE DART TO DENROV, GO TO CITY GRAVEYARD, X ROOT, X HEADSTONES, TAKE IRON KEY, USE IRON KEY ON GATE, D, X BODY, TAKE BLOWPIPE, LIFT BODY, TAKE RING, X RING, GO TO LOBSTER LANE, GIVE RING TO RANGO, GO TO THIEVES GUILD, SPEAK TO MALAKO STORMCHASER, GIVE RING TO MALAKO, GO TO ANIMAL YARD, X CAGE, GIVE MEAT TO SABRE-CAT, PUSH CAGE, OPEN MANHOLE, D, S, E, S, SE, SPEAK TO CONAS WRETCH, LIFT CONAS, TAKE DAGGER, X DAGGER, GO TO FIELD GATE, TAKE CARTWHEEL, GO TO MONUMENT SQUARE, X FOUNTAIN, TAKE GOLD COIN, GO TO BLACKSMITHS, GIVE CARTWHEEL TO SAMUS, GIVE COIN TO SAMUS, GO TO FIELD GATE, USE CARTWHEEL ON CART, PUSH CART, GO TO BROOK, USE DAGGER ON BROOK, GO TO ARMOURERS, GIVE DAGGER TO VANDOS, GO TO ANIMAL YARD, D, S, SW, S, S, KNOCK ON MARK, E, USE DAGGER ON RED PRIEST, TAKE STAFF, GO TO THIEVES GUILD, GIVE STAFF TO MALAKO, GO TO OUTSIDE OF WHITE TOWER, USE STAFF ON DOOR, GO TO ORNATE ROOM, LIFT RUG, TAKE SCROLL, READ SCROLL, GO TO LOBSTER LANE, GIVE SCROLL TO RANGO, GO TO THIEVES GUILD, SPEAK TO MALAKO, GO TO CITY PRISON, SPEAK TO BALLUM, USE DART ON BLOWPIPE, USE BLOWPIPE ON BALLUM, USE GOLDEN KEY ON DOOR, OPEN DOOR, N, GIVE SCROLL TO ALKAZAR, GIVE STAFF TO ALKAZAR, X MATTRESS, TAKE SILVER KEY, GO TO ORNATE ROOM, OPEN BLUE BOX, X BOX, USE SILVER KEY ON TRUNK, OPEN TRUNK, X TRUNK, TAKE ROPE AND GRAPNEL, U, OPEN TELESCOPE, TAKE PAGE, READ PAGE, GO TO GOBLIN’S HEAD TAVERN, TAKE MATCHES, GO TO ORC’S TOOTH TAVERN, W, USE MATCHES ON POSTER, W, TAKE CROWBAR, GO TO WAREHOUSE, USE CROWBAR ON CRATE, X CRATE, TAKE BUST, GO TO DRACO’S EMPORIUM, GIVE BUST TO DRACO, TAKE NOSEPLUGS, TAKE GLUE, TAKE RUM, GO TO FLOWER SHOP, SPEAK TO MARJEL, GO TO PUBLIC GARDENS, USE NOSEPLUGS, TAKE FLOWER, GO TO SWORDFISH WHARF, GIVE RUM TO JONG, GO TO CARGOHOLD, TAKE RAT, GO TO MUSEUM OF DEATH, USE RAT ON GUILLOTINE, GO TO SWORDFISH WHARF, PUSH CASKS, W, USE SMALL KEY ON SAFE, OPEN SAFE, X SAFE, TAKE DEED, GO TO COTTAGE, SPEAK TO TANNITH, GIVE DEED TO TANNITH, GO TO ALLEY OF KNIVES, USE ROPE ON DRAIN, TAKE NECKLACE, GO TO SAILMAKERS, GIVE NECKLACE TO YOBI, GO TO BEDROOM, USE MATCHES ON COALPILE, USE EGG ON FIRE, USE NET ON PHOENIX, TAKE PHOENIX, PLUCK PHOENIX, GO TO UNDERTAKERS, X CATAFALQUE, TAKE CANDLE, GO TO TEMPLE OF THE SEVEN MOONS, USE MATCHES ON CANDLE, USE CANDLE ON CANDELABRUM, GO TO CITY MORGUE, X CORPSE, USE TALISMAN ON VAMPIRE, TAKE WOODEN ROD, USE ROD ON GLUE, GO TO BARN, USE ROD ON RAFTERS, TAKE MAP, GO TO CARTOGRAPHERS, GIVE MAP TO SALVORI, TAKE INK, GO TO MARKET SQUARE, X NOTICEBOARD, READ PETITION, USE FEATHER ON INK, USE FEATHER ON PETITION, USE CROWBAR ON PLACARD, GO TO BOATYARD, GIVE NAIL TO IVANO, GO TO CAPTAIN’S CABIN, GIVE AMULET TO CAPTAIN BLOODAXE, GO TO WAILING BRIDGE, X BRIDGE, CLIMB LADDER, OPEN DOOR, S, SPEAK TO CARACUS, GIVE FLOWER TO CARACUS, GIVE FEATHER TO CARACUS, GIVE TOOTH TO CARACUS, GO TO ROYAL STABLES, X HORSE, LIFT SADDLE, TAKE POUCH, OPEN POUCH, GO TO CATFISH TAVERN, TAKE GOBLET, GO TO WINE SELLERS, USE GOBLET ON BARREL, USE SLEEPING POWDER ON GOBLET, GO TO KING’S SCEPTRE INN, GIVE GOBLET TO CAPTAIN EOMARK, LIFT CAPTAIN, TAKE CRYSTAL KEY, GO TO NARROW ALLEY, USE ROPE ON ROOFTOP, CLIMB ROPE, JUMP TO WINDOW, USE CROWBAR ON WINDOW, GO TO BALCONY, GO TO THRONE ROOM, USE CRYSTAL KEY ON THRONE, GO TO SANCTUM, USE POTION ON VELMAHT, GO TO BLUE FROG TAVERN, SPEAK TO ALKAZAR.
